title: [Large-Scale] Reflective Thinking-Based Advanced Language PBL Design

context.prior_knowledge: Academic Writing and Language Analysis Fundamentals, PBL (Project-Based Learning) Experience
context.additional_context: A language research course emphasizing collaborative problem-solving in digital device-enabled environments

learning_goals: Learners can generate reflective questions in complex language problem situations and write self-assessment reports with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can propose at least three revisions for language projects incorporating peer feedback using digital collaboration tools.
Learners can complete case study reports by applying the five-stage reflective thinking model (Description-Analysis-Interpretation-Synthesis-Evaluation) in PBL processes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
